column4: Ok, when I do: find ./ -name *.swp it shows like 10 listings. But when I do: rm -r *.swp it says there is no such file or directory *.swp. Does rm not allow *?
find searches recursive and 'rm -r' doesn't do what you think it does
-r, -R, --recursive              remove directories and their contents recursively .. ?
yes.. you can remove directories and it's content but it doesn't search recursive for your string
